headerText: The `v-expansion-panel` component is useful for reducing vertical space with large amounts of information. The default functionality of the component is to only display one expansion-panel body at a time; however, with the `expandable` property, the expansion-panel can remain open until explicitly closed.

usage.desc: Accordion expansion-panels can only have 1 panel open at a time.

expand.desc: Expand expansion-panels will stay open until closed. When providing a model, any value not specified will be interpreted as false.

external.desc: Expansion panels can be controlled externally by modifying the `v-model`. Its value corresponds to a zero-based index of the currently opened expansion panel content. If `expand` prop is used then it is an array of booleans where the index corresponds to the index of the content.

disabledAndReadonly.desc: Both the expansion-panel and its content supports the `disabled` and `readonly` props.

popout.desc: The expansion-panel also has two alternative designs you can activate with the props `popout` and `inset`.

customIcons.desc: Expand action icon can be customized with `expand-icon` prop.

focusable.desc: The expansion-panel headers can be made focusable with the prop `focusable`.

v-expansion-panel.expand: Leaves the expansion-panel open while selecting another
v-expansion-panel.inset: Makes the expansion-panel open with a inset style
v-expansion-panel.popout: Makes the expansion-panel open with an popout style
v-expansion-panel.readonly: Makes the entire expansion-panel read only.
v-expansion-panel.value: Controls the opened/closed state of content in the expansion-panel. Corresponds to a zero-based index of the currently opened content. If `expand` prop is used then it is an array of booleans where the index corresponds to the index of the content.

v-expansion-panel-content.hideActions: Hide the expand icon in the content header
v-expansion-panel-content.readonly: Makes the expansion-panel content read only.
v-expansion-panel-content.value: Controls the opened/closed state of content
